Job description

Synopsis

Supervisor Street and Beach Services (Night Shift Operations)

  • Based at our South Melbourne Depot
  • Working days and hours (Monday – Friday) 10pm – 6am
  • Salary Range $75,511 - $81,072 (annualised salary which comprises of Early Shift loading, industry allowance, maintenance allowance, leave loading) + 9.5% Superannuation

    • Our Street and Beach Service team seeks suitably qualified and experienced candidates to undertake the Supervisor Street & Beach Services (Night Shift Operations).

    You will need good team supervisory and communication skills, the ability to build positive relationships to facilitate and organise the completion of scheduled and reactive street and beach cleaning operations, and have a commitment to actively contribute to operational requirements to ensure that high quality street and beach cleaning services are delivered to the community.

    The successful candidate will support the Coordinator and Supervisors Street and Beach Services to deliver the ongoing cleaning program of the city's streets, commercial areas and beaches. The supervisor role will be directly responsible for maintaining high standards of service to the community, complaint management, customer service and ensuring performance standards are achieved.

    Proven experience in supervision of similar labouring industry and demonstrated proficiency of designing and implementing program maintenance works, together with knowledge of OHS legislative requirements will be necessary in this leadership role. This role will require working across weekends on a roster basis.

  • Victorian endorsed truck licence required
  • Position subject to satisfactory medical check

    • Please click the link below to view a copy of the position description.

    Further information can be obtained by contacting Darren Brownscombe on 9209 6765.

    Applicants must respond to the Key Selection Criteria contained in the Position Description.

    Applications close midnight Sunday 9 September 2018.

Service Desk Analyst

Company Name Catholic Education Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Full-Time, two year fixed-term role in East Melbourne


Catholic Education Melbourne is a dynamic education service provider to 331 Catholic schools in the Archdiocese of Melbourne. More than 450 staff work across four regional offices and in its central office in East Melbourne. The Office offers flexible working arrangements, generous salary and conditions, and the opportunity to enhance the education of more than 140,000 students. This community is committed to the safety, wellbeing and protection of all children in our care.

\xa0

The ICON Project will provide a common technology platform for teaching, learning and school administration for Catholic schools in Victoria. The role works closely with ICON, Catholic Education Melbourne staff, schools and ICON vendors. You will play an integral part in the ICON support model as the first point of contact for schools during the implementation phase.

\xa0

As an experienced help desk professional, you will:


  • Bring previous experience in service desk/help desk support within a complex ICT ERP program
  • Know how to record and report incidents
  • Ideally have an understanding or knowledge with Google or GAFE applications
  • Be a sound communicator with highly developed organisational and time management skills.

\xa0

The successful applicant will also be subject to a Working with Children Check and a National Police Record Check.


HOW TO APPLY
Further information about the position, including a detailed position description and application requirements,\xa0 can be accessed via the Job Search tab on the CEM website at www.cem.edu.au and selecting ‘Catholic Education Staff’ under the ‘Filter by Role’ field.

\xa0

Applicants need to provide:

  1. a separate statement addressing the Key Selection Criteria
  2. a Cover Letter and
  3. an up to date Curriculum Vitae including contact details of two referees

\xa0

Applications can be uploaded via the ‘Apply’ tab on the CEM website. All enquiries can be directed to the Recruitment Officer at recruitment@cem.edu.au or (03) 9267 0228.

\xa0

Applications close: 4pm, Tuesday 11 September 2018 \xa0

Contact the job poster

Lybbi Stigsdottir

Human Resources/Recruitment

[

Lecturer A -Nursing

Company Name Swinburne University of Technology Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • \xa0Academic Level A, $67,015 – $90,250 + 17% super
  • Focused on high-quality teaching and active engagement with industry and community
  • Full-time, ongoing, Hawthorn/Wantirna location


If you are looking for your next exciting opportunity come join the School of Health Sciences, providing strong and energetic leadership in research and teaching.


About Swinburne\xa0
Swinburne University of Technology has a long, proud history of educating and training students for over 100 years. Swinburne focuses on providing high-quality, career-oriented education with strong links to industry and the community. Swinburne currently has over 54,000 students.

Swinburne’s emphasis is on high quality, engaged teaching and research in science, technology, business, design and innovation – teaching and research that makes a difference in the lives of individuals and contributes to national economic and social objectives.

Swinburne is a progressive university that aims to increase Australia’s capacity in science, technology and innovation as the drivers of modern, internationalised economies and workplaces. Our university is focused on high-impact global research, high-quality teaching and active engagement with both industry and the community.

About the job
If you are looking for your next exciting opportunity this position is what you have been searching for. Be part of a community of committed and passionate staff and make a real difference. This is an exciting opportunity to join our new and dynamic nursing team as we introduce Higher Education nursing programs into Swinburne University.

You will contribute to the development and delivery of Nursing courses at both undergraduate and graduate levels. This will include preparation and delivery of online material, tutorials, practical classes, clinical sessions and other active learning sessions to promote innovative, flexible and accessible learning environments.

As the successful candidate, will be involved in ensuring the highest quality educational experience for students. You will be expected to contribute to research activities in the School of Health Sciences

Skills and experience
To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate the following:
• A minimum of a Graduate Certificate in Nursing
• Working towards Masters
• NMBA registration as a Registered Nurse
• Currency of professional clinical experience

A full list of the selection criteria is available within the position description

Benefits\xa0
To find out more about the extensive benefits offered to Swinburne employees please visit:
http://www.swinburne.edu.au/about/jobs/why-work-at-swinburne/

Some of excellent benefits include:
• Participate in regular staff and management development programs
• Onsite health services
• Private health insurance discounts
• Salary package your car parking, superannuation and vehicle lease plans. It can help you get the most value from what you earn.

Further information and how to apply\xa0
The diverse culture within Swinburne is a source of strength. We have an inclusive working environment with employees from a variety of backgrounds. We acknowledge that diversity in the university workforce increases the effectiveness of teams and our capacity for innovation. We welcome applications from Indigenous people, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

We are proud to be recognised by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2016 and of key initiatives such as our Pride@Swinburne Strategic Action Plan and our Reconciliation Action Plan which are integral components of our 2025 vision to be world class university creating social and economic impact through science, technology and innovation.

To start an application click on 'apply' at the bottom of this page and submit a resume, cover letter and response to the Key Selection Criteria, as listed in the Position Description.

Swinburne University of Technology is a Child Safe Organisation and as part of this commitment, we require all employees to have a current Working with Children’s Check.

All appointments are subject to a valid Working with Children’s Check, therefore it will be a mandatory requirement to have and maintain a current Working with Children Check.
Please do not email or send paper applications, all applications must be submitted online.

For further information about the position, please contact Assoc Prof Georgina Willetts on +61 3 9214 8747 or gwilletts@swin.edu.au.

If you are experiencing technical difficulties with your application, please contact the Recruitment team on +61 3 9214 8600 (option 2).

Should you require further support for an interview due to special needs or consideration, please contact our Diversity Consultant, Dr. Walter Robles, on inclusion@swin.edu.au, or our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Employment Officer, Sherrin Trautmann on strautmann@swin.edu.au.

Applications close at 11.30pm, Friday 28th September 2018.

Philosophy and Humanities Teacher

Company Name St Michael's Grammar School Company Location St Kilda

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 47 views

Job description

Full time, ongoing position


We are looking for an experienced Philosophy and Humanities Teacher to deliver effective teaching, learning and caring programs in Years 7-12. You must be aligned with the School’s ethos, vision and values. You are curious, excited and invigorated by learning and are a continuous, autonomous learner who makes visible their own learning. You will possess a positive outlook, exceptional interpersonal skills and high emotional intelligence with demonstrated ability to build authentic, collaborative relationships.


The successful applicant must:



  • be a qualified teacher and be able to demonstrate a suitable tertiary qualification in teaching and their methods

  • have experience teaching Humanities in Years 7-10

  • be able to teach VCE Philosophy, in line with the new 2019-2023 VCE Philosophy Study Design

  • be willing to be involved in all aspects of the School’s program

  • possess strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and interact with both adults and students

  • have high level communication skills

  • be able to work independently but also as part of a dynamic, creative and collaborative team.

  • hold a current registration with the Victorian Institute of Teaching (VIT)

  • hold an Anaphylaxis Certificate, or willing to obtain this prior to commencement

  • have a current National Police Check or be willing to obtain one prior to commencement


This is a full time, ongoing position commencing in January 2019.


Key benefits of working at St Michael’s Grammar School include:



  • Competitive salaries including Teacher salary packages commencing at $92,683

  • 10% superannuation

  • Range of salary packaging options

  • Flexible work opportunities

  • On-site caf

  • Professional and Career development opportunities

  • Employee Assistance Program available to staff

  • Active staff association

  • Stimulating work & learning environment

  • Culture of celebrating success


St Michael’s Grammar School is committed to child safety. As such, the successful applicant will be expected to satisfy child protection screening, and adhere to the School’s Child Safe Policy and Code of Conduct. These documents may be downloaded from the Schools website.


Closing date for applications is 10am on Monday, 10 September 2018.


For more information, please see the position description below.


If this sounds like the role you’ve been waiting for ’APPLY NOW’.


Please submit your details, resume and cover letter outlining in detail your experience and ability to meet the requirements of this role. Please note that applications without cover letters will not be considered.


If you would like to discuss this role, please contact Miss Anna Borovska, People and Strategy Officer, on 03 8530 3341.

Be an early applicant

Job description

Work is a whole lot better when you love what you do, we know that. That’s why we make sure that the loves and interests of our people match their responsibilities. We take what they love, and we let them live it.


So, do you want to be part of a team who loves coming to work each day? A team that makes Myer a great place to shop, and an even greater place to work?


Become part of our transformation journey, and we’ll help you write your own future.


  • Entry level role with the opportunity to be succession planned for future roles
  • Opportunity to develop and hone your skills within the Merchandise Department
  • Exposure across the business
  • Docklands based

About the role


  • As the Replenishment Analyst you are responsible for delivering the merchandise strategy \xa0ensuring stock availability in-store and online to meet customer demand
  • You will be responsible for conducting replenishment plans, including but not limited to: reviewing system orders, supporting inventory stock levels and delivering a smooth flow of replenishment merchandise throughout the supply chain
  • Proactively communicate with multiple stakeholders within the business
  • Manage the replenishment season performance and optimising appropriate system capabilities to continually improve stock and sales performance.
  • Support the Merchandise team through the Demand Planning function by providing specialist advice to the business.

About you


  • Able to proactively interact with key stakeholders to work through and adhere to the crucial time lines of the Demand Planning and Replenishment Critical Path
  • Can effectively monitor product performance, including tracking performance, identification of best sellers and poor performing products and tracking and managing supplier delivery performance
  • Preferably have exposure to standard reporting processes such as Quintile Reports, Daily Sales, Forecast Analysis and Out of Stock
  • Able to Manage expectations, communicate clearly and ensure that issues are escalated and managed appropriately

Benefit to you:


  • Team member discount
  • Volunteer, parental and lifestyle leave available
  • Service Recognition
  • Inspirational People Awards
  • Career growth and succession opportunities

Don’t miss\xa0this opportunity to show your talent and explore the great career path\xa0at Myer.


APPLY NOW!

Key Account Manager, Melbourne

Company Name Meltwater Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 19 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Key Account Manager role at Meltwater is both a rewarding and challenging opportunity to partner with some of our most exciting clients in AUNZ. This is an opportunity to work with a rapidly growing portfolio of clients who are challenging the media intelligence and data analytics space whilst driving strategic change across the business. We want our key account managers to challenge existing norms within our industry, and act not only as a Meltwater product expert but as an extension of our clients' team, consulting on long term business objectives and developing strong professional relationships.

Our AUNZ key accounts team continues to be at the forefront of Meltwater's product development and in driving change management and product implementation on the client side, this is a team of highly skilled, knowledgeable and tech savvy consultants who have the most engaging clients in our AUNZ portfolio. This is a rewarding career move that has high earning potential, plenty of career opportunities, and a strong focus on people and culture.

If you feel like this is an opportunity for you, then click “Apply Now”! We're hiring in both Sydney and Melbourne!

Location Sydney: Angel Place, Level 25, 123 Pitt St, Sydney CBD

Location Melbourne: Rialto, Level 38, 525 Collins Street, Melbourne CBD

Your Responsibilities
  • Manage a portfolio of approximately 40-60 platinum and gold AUNZ clients who have the largest spend and growth potential in the business
  • Meet and exceed monthly sales KPIs both at individual and team target level
  • Build positive, long-lasting relationships through customer engagement to increase value and drive market share
  • Implement strategies to drive business growth and inform decision-making at C-Suite level
  • Increase revenue by negotiating contract renewals for long-term subscriptions while developing up-sale and cross-sale opportunities
  • Work across all verticals; including non-profit, ASX100 listed, government and more...
  • Inform and drive knowledge by challenging the status quo across traditional and social channels


Your Skills
  • University degree with strong academic results
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills, we are looking for someone who is clear, concise and convincing in their communication, and is comfortable negotiating and presenting with the C-Suite
  • Relationship savvy! Effective key account managers are able to read people and connect with them in meaningful ways, building and maintaining strong relationships with our clients is a critical KPI that will measure your success in this role
  • 2-4 years of account management experience (key account management preferred) with a proven track record of success, we want people who have an appetite for learning and who are not afraid to challenge the norm
  • Adaptability to change, ownership and accountability, attention to detail, and an ability to work independently and as a team, are all characteristics that we are looking for in our newest team member/s
  • Stamina, drive and killer instinct! This is a results orientated role that requires focus on achieving specific goals and needs for your clients, while also maintaining monthly sales targets and driving the bottom line of the business
  • Strong business acumen, a passion for technology, and you should be a regular consumer of the news/ media
  • Excellent level of proficiency in written and spoken English
  • Eligibility to work in Australia


We Are Offering
  • A dynamic, exciting work environment that has been experiencing tremendous growth for the last few years
  • A high level of responsibility and autonomy within the team, this is a role that will give you the opportunity to develop your skills and learn on the job, every day, while managing a multimillion dollar portfolio of clients
  • Strong culture and people development focus, your success is our success, your individual development is important to us from day one, and we will continue to provide training and management skills development throughout your career. You will have regular touch points with the Managing Director, Country Manager, and exposure to other senior managers within the business
  • The potential to influence and craft a growing team and its culture
  • Accelerated performance-based promotion program with international opportunities available

  • Internet
  • Online Media
